intro: Sisyrinchium micranthum, commonly known as the narrowleaf blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like foliage and small, showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It produces slender, branching stems that bear numerous flowers clustered at the tips. Sisyrinchium micranthum is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
